channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: London's Trendiest Office Space - Lead and Mid-Level Perl Developer roles
item.description: I love working in a vibrant, modern space. If youâ€™re going to spend all day at work, it might as well be somewhere you enjoy being, rather than a cubicle farm. This client has a workspace Iâ€™m actively jealous of!

item.title: Be a trailblazer in a time of growth - Full Stack Architect required for a rapidly expanding London company
item.description: If youâ€™re currently a senior full stack developer looking to take on your next role as an architect then this is a great opportunity to do so in a company that is both ambitious and supportive. Increased job satisfaction is another perk, as their codebase is notably new and clean and the team are committed to using modern practices.

item.title: Rapid Growth in Perl - developers wanted for an expanding central London company
item.description: According the Guinness Book of World Records, the fastest growing plant is a species of bamboo, which grows at a rate of up to 91cm a day. The fastest growing economy in the world is currently Ethiopia, with a projected growth in GDP of over 8% this year. And although the record for fastest growing Perl team might not be recorded in the Guinness Book of records, our client is a strong contender.

item.title: Open file to read and write in Perl, oh and lock it too
NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Booking.com Sponsors the P5CMF
item.description: Those who do not know, P5CMF stands for "Perl 5 Core Maintainance Fund"

item.title: Call for volunteers - TPC::NA 2018 (formerly knows as YAPC::NA)
item.description: Perl helps you to pay your bills, right? If you want to pay back to the community, then this is a good chance. TPC::NA organizing committee needs your help.

item.title: Nominate Perl heroes for the 2017 White Camel Awards
item.description: If you know someone in the Perl community who has done significant non-technical work for Perl, then please let Brian know about it.

item.title: 2017.49 Mischieventing
item.description: The weekly roundup of Rakudo news.

item.title: And here we go!
item.description: John wrote a series of blog posts explaining his journey of his SQLDataAccessor module (not yet on CPAN). I have included the first blog post in the series, you can continue from here & read rest of his posts here

item.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: November 21st - December 5th
London Perl Workshop 2017 - Talks Review
item.description: Mohammad S Anwar wrote about the talks he attended at LPW

item.title: Dancer Advent Calendar
item.description: They are a couple of days behind as I write this, but the Dancer team has produced an Advent calendar since 2010.

item.title: Mojolicious Advent Calendar
item.description: Joel has started a new blog for Mojolicious, and is kicking it off in grand style, with an Advent calendar.

item.title: Perl 6 Advent Calendar
item.description: Every year since 2009--no fancy calendar, just great blog entries every year in the weeks leading up to Christmas.

item.title: #333 - Who deserves White Camel Award? :)
item.description:
Hi everyone

TPC::NA 2018 (formerly known as YAPC::NA) organizing committee is looking for volunteers, please give them a hand.

Plenty of blog posts this week (thanks to the people who are writing advent calendars).
